review.title: “Definition of Corporate Moneygrubbing”
review.pros: Pros – It's easy to understand this job if you realize that your only function is to make money for the corporate office.General Manager at my store is great, most employees work hard. Those who don't don't last.
review.cons: Cons – Wages, expectations, problem solving, accountability, big picture, morale.Everything is based on sales, not reality. I work third shift as a Team Leader and as such my function is chief cook and bottle washer, scapegoat, and problem solver. The company condescends to allow two employees on third shift and expects us to clean showers and restrooms, sweep and mop the whole store, take out trash from store and fuel islands (you know what's in the diesel trash cans), keep food in production, handle customer problems that are not our responsibility, stock the entire coffee bar, make six kinds of tea (only three of which sell), oh and WAIT ON CUSTOMERS.There is an Assistant General Manager in my region who is very stressful to work for and disrupts our work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop wasting time on minutiae such as cleaning Transflos 3 times a day, stacking condiments straight in the bins, deli opening and closing checklists and shower and restroom GI records. Allow us to work more efficiently.Utilize the coffee hostess by allowing her to do more stocking and cleaning of the coffee/deli bar. This takes the pressure off third shift having to have everything stocked for her. It also takes the pressure off her by enabling her to have the coffee bar in spic and span condition for health department inspections and mystery shops. Don't put the onus of coffee sales solely on her. Don't base mystery shops on her selling but the condition of the coffee/deli area and the products in that area. She is under a microscope and you are putting too much pressure and responsibility on her.Quit emphasizing that you expect clean restrooms. The overhead "courtesy check" announcements and signage enable customers to make mean comments accusing us of not doing our job just because we can't check that every customer has flushed the toilet and not used the last of the toilet paper and paper towels. When customers smear excrement on the bathroom walls and write expletives in it, (yes they do, more often than you would be willing to admit, and it usually consists of disparaging comments about the company) that is behavior that has been encouraged as mockery of the announcements and signs. Put restrooms on the diesel islands with trash cans for disposal of empty urine jugs after they have been flushed down the urinals. Since you expect us to handle biohazardous waste, provide us protection.Allow enough hours of payroll to have more people on staff. One more maintenance person, one more deli employee, and one more cashier on first and second shift would still have work to do but we could do it better with less pressure. On the rare occasion there are three trained people on third shift, we work hard through the shift but we are able to get everything done without the pressure of knowing that we are letting the coffee hostess, maintenance, and deli employees down by not getting everything done. If you really cared what the customers think, they tell us all the time we are working too hard. They see that, but they understandably expect the restrooms to be cleaner, a greater variety of food, and the diesel pumps not to vapor lock three or more times a night. The good employees know what needs to be done and do our best to get it done. We could amaze you and the customers with what we can do with adequate staffing. We don't need the knowledge that we are going to get in trouble for not completing our jobs because it's physically impossible to do so. It's a constant headache and hot poker to the gut. It is inevitable that people call off or don't show from time to time. Having more people on the schedule and more hours available for more personnel on the payroll would enable us to pick up the slack and/or have more people to call in.Quit covering your asses by making us lie and say we had all our breaks when we sign our time cards each week and threatening to fire us if we don't take them. You don't allow us enough people to do even the minimum of what you expect. We have to work through our breaks just to do the bare minimum that keeps the company running.When minimum wage increases result in higher wages for minimum wage employees, give commensurate increases to all other hourly employees. Pay us for what you expect out of us.

review.cons: Cons – Not great pay, a lot of hours, terrible insurance.

review.title: “One hard,long, work day.....”
review.pros: Pros – While the pay and benefits are NOT pros in this company, the lessons in life are. While your body is busy being tortured with labor and stress,take this time to reflect on what is good in your life. We are put on this Earth for a reason and for me working at this company is it. When a customer comes up to me and says: "You're working way too hard", I think to myself: " wow good job!". Our purpose is not always clear in life, but for me there are people out there that recognize what we are going through.
review.cons: Cons – Ignorance. Plain and simple. Even the management has it at times. Other times there are just overbearing simpletons who it seems would rather ruin your day than try to make it a bit easier.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Same as other reviews, try a better wage for dedicated,hardworking employees. And maybe fake a bit of concern for people's struggles in life. We all have things we are going through at this company.

review.title: “Better jobs exist.”
review.pros: Pros – -Good work experience. You really can learn a lot while on the job.-Fellow employees are some of the nicest people I've ever met.
review.cons: Cons – -Poor pay. The way I see it, if you want to pay your employees minimum wage, then expect that type of work.-There is no balance for your personal life/poor scheduling.-You're basically on call 24/7.-Constant visits from corporate, who are always there to complain about something and not offer any assistance on how it should be fixed. These are also the days your managers work you the hardest.-Training is less than sufficient. The videos tell you a lot of information you'll never use (for maintenance, that is). I was shown how to clean showers. Everything else was up to me to learn through trial and error.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get your act together. Talk to your employees more. My managers only speak with me when they want more work done on top of what I'm doing. Come out of the office for more than 5 minutes every hour; You might actually know what's going on in the store. You want superhuman efforts? Maybe the payroll should reflect that. Also, 1 maintenance guy isn't enough for a full shift. You're working people to death for little compensation. That's why so many employees leave for better working conditions. I certainly have much more to say, but won't for the time being.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Flexibility and appreciation for employees would improve work place morale and employee satisfaction.

review.title: “An Endurance Test, But One to Grow On...”
review.pros: Pros – A very fast-paced learning experience. Work objectives were easy enough... I never had any major problems scheduling around my classes while attending college...Much respect to some of the general managers I had, who were mostly even-tempered and helpful through their own workload... I was able to work as little or as long of a work week as necessary...It was certainly a job - and an endeavor to grow on, which brings me to my next point...
review.cons: Cons – You're essentially doing the work of a Walmart employee, a custodian, as well as a cashier for a glamorous minimum wage. The transactions a team member processes deal with food, fuel, grocery, merchandise, and tobacco. If you work during the day, you're guaranteed to get a steady to constant flow of customers, and during the rare time periods where you're not assisting people you're involved with cleaning the counter and the deli/coffee section. I realize that professional drivers carry out a job considered by many to be in a most dubious category, but a lot of the kind of people that stopped in at this store were representatives of the downside of mankind. As a team member, you're putting in a remarkable effort at keeping things rolling and attempting to meet the needs of these people to total indifference, or even humiliation when something would go wrong with the erroneous P.O.S. systems or when one customer would be in a particularly rude mood. Not to mention that I felt like the company would be setting up team members for this kind of backlash with their methods of pricing. I stuck it out being a team member here, and my good will ultimately got me through the toils of this customer service position.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – This is a fast-paced, complex work environment that you're throwing team members into. If you're going to expect a superhuman effort from each employee, don't pay a joke of a wage. Sooner or later, the more solid workers will find better opportunities at much better companies.

review.cons: Cons – Very little toleration of anything but perfectionIf you screw up even slightly once, your job could easily be in jeopardy. Screw up twice, heads roll with no hesitation. Definitley not a good career stop for most. There is no family/work life balance regardless of what your told while interviewing.

Non stop visits from HQ people that say what is wrong but, don't step up to help.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You make 0.18$ per gallon of diesel spend some on hourly wages and more payroll to drive customer service which is what you preach. Back it up and quit lining your pockets to buy a football team

review.title: “If you like running all day and never getting anyting done, then this is the job for you.”
review.pros: Pros – I enjoyed building rapport with the customers and employees, but you get that in any retail setting.
review.cons: Cons – Like the rest of the retail world, salary means you work a lot of hours. I did average about 50 most of the time, but some weeks were 60-70. The pay is not great- I made a lot more at Walgreens for the same position. The corporate support system is not that good. The computers are always having some kind of problem- some issues go on for months without being addressed. We had 30 year old gas pumps that the techs had problems finding parts for. They were constantly messing up and it frustrated the customers. It was frustrating listening to the complaining from the customers when it wasn't our fault. The employees' pay was pitiful. This led to high turnover. They cut hours during the winter, so everyone had to get used to making less money during this season. Not really fair in my opinion
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – For this business model to work, you have to have good people and keep them. $8 an hour gives you no chance of doing this.

review.cons: Cons – Crap management training they tell you about imortant things but never teach you. no job shadowingbenefits are crazy expensive @ 129.00 per week.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Speed of service is important but so is quality of service. Customers don't want to be rushed anymore than they want to be delayed.Passive aggressive actions by upper management creates a hostile work environment. Hence the actions by the opening RGM at store #596 and when I said something to her manager I was let go.

review.title: “This company has left me with a bitter taste in my mouth that has slowly began to erode the lining in my stomach.”
review.pros: Pros – I've made 2 very good friends while working for this company.
review.cons: Cons – Since our company was taken over, workers that have been employed for years have suddenly become seen as incompetent and obsolete. Pay raises are almost nonexistent, and promotions go to the worst possible employees, who, by the way, receive very little training. The worst part is, former full time employees are stripped of their hours, forced to work only 3 or 4 days, but the company keeps hiring new employees, intentionally reducing the number of hours available for each employee.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We have 2 general managers at our store, but somehow our store is among the worst managed i've ever seen. The problem is that both GMs are so concerned that the other might receive a moment of recognition that the other does not, or that one may get a smile from corporate management that the other misses, that they cannot manage effectively. Our night shift team is a mess, and coming from one who has had the task of managing that shift, I can honestly say it is not the fault of the lower management team. They can only do so much with what they are given, but they carry the blame if anything goes wrong. It does not take a genius to figure out that with 2 GMs, one should always be available to work nights. This will avoid any uneducated finger pointing when something is not done because it is very easy to blame someone else for their perceived shortcomings when you have never tried to work their position.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop driving all year experienced staff out the door just to save money...drop the promote from within since you dont...stop being so greedy...

review.cons: Cons – Numerous drivers hitting on you. If you can't take a joke don't work here. Management switches all the time.

Literally. Great job if you like people and know multiple languages.

review.title: “Like being in the military without the benefits”

review.title: “Terrible, empty promises, treated like dirt”

review.cons: Cons – Way too much responsibility, with too little pay, talked to and spoken to like a child
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Respect your employees! Show them that you care!

review.title: “Completely incompetent upper management.”
review.pros: Pros – I've met a few cool people while working here.

Horrible pay, uneducated hiring, etc. I could write an entire book about this but the gist of it is that the upper management is lazy and incompetent , and they don't seem to care. review.title: “Chaotic and Horrible”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Respect your employee's more, and learn how to do your job and take care of customer's needs better.

review.title: “They do what they say they will”

Senior management know me by name, and some even know and care about my family. The first time I met Jimmy Haslam, after six months of employment at a training session in Knoxville, he asked me how my wife, son, and horse were adapting to our new home. review.title: “Good for a resume builder”

review.cons: Cons – Corporate office positions are being compared with retail positions. I started with $10.50/hour. In the retail world that's outstanding. review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – 1/ Make your choices in management wisely.I know supervisors that barely have a high school education and there is a lot that they need to learn. Perhaps because they advise us to aim for a 7 in the scale of 1 to 10. Apparently mediocracy have been working for them...2/ Increase the rate of pay for hourly employees instead of giving them access to a ridiculous health coverage that in the long run does not benefit the employees since it leaves them with pre existing conditions if they seek coverage elsewere . This change could help reduce turn over, which would lead to increased productivity within the company.

review.title: “Great people at my location, not a big fan of corporatism though”

Most of the customers I get are really cool people, and the 2% that are pissed off or bitter about something, I just remind myself that it's nothing personal and move on.
review.cons: Cons – To be fair I came to work here with a lot of experience, but the training was abysmal. I had to learn pretty much everything here on my own. A lot of trial and error is involved and it can get frustrating. I also wish the labor wasn't so tight. It's really annoying being called so often to come and work for someone when I've already planned my week ahead of time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – A greater emphasis on training is needed. Obviously, the labor issue and the training issue are inter-related. I know Pilot is making insane amounts of profit right now. Invest some of that into training please.

review.title: “A place to grow, so you can move on to a better organization”

review.cons: Cons – Top management is not people oriented to any degreeTop management is more interested in doing new deals than sticking to its knitting
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to get it right next time.

review.title: “Abominable Employee Relations”
review.pros: Pros – Fellow employees at this center are, in the majority, very likable, and out customer base of truckers were fantastic people.
review.cons: Cons – In this 24-hour truck stop we had 12 lower level employees and 4 supervisor/managers, yet no management was available. It was common for the 2 cashiers on duty (usually one) to have their registers locked up and 20 or more people backed up in line, simply because a manager would not come out of the office to clear the problems. Training was non-existant. Employees are not allowed to verify their start tills. Breaks are clocked out for, but worked. Customer service is never a priority. Management gossips about management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire some management. This particular store is on its 6th general manager in 4 years.

review.title: “Prepare To Be Sucked Dry And Spit Out”
review.pros: Pros – Active job with many different facets to keep you busy.Good job stability for crew members who can show up to work.
review.cons: Cons – Ridiculous labor standards.Incredible favoratism from upper management.What have you done for me lately means in the last week.A great manager is someone who works more hours than anyone else.Pathetic, almost non-existant training hours available to develop crew.A "human resources" department that exists to defend upper managements whims.Politics, politics, politics...brown nosers please apply.A company culture that could care less about the employees outside life and if they burn out...well there are always more desperate people out there to use up!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Realize that there is a reason you had around 150 first year managers last year, and it is not the great opportunities the company offers. Ask yourself why 98% (literally) of your current management staff has been with the company less than ten years, and 80% less than five years. It was not always like this, what has changed in the last five years to cause such incredible turnover. My answer is insane labor standards, little to no accurate feedback from overworked regional managers, and upper management who only wants to hear what they want to hear. How can you ever get any accurate information when all of your GM's are scared to say anything except what you want to hear? I have seen several long term managers be labled lazy complainers for bringing up issues, and could tell hours of stories of horrible labor situations managers have been put in. If every customer complaint about labor that was directed to local level management came directly to you, I think things would change quickly. But hey, even the complaints about staffing that DO reach you are labled the GM's fault so maybe it wouldn't make a difference.

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay your people better to keep your them happier. Expand the parking facility at HQ. Continue to reward good work with bonus and other perks.

review.title: “If you don't mind low pay with ever increasing demands on your limited time, This is the job for you.”

review.title: “pilot is a good positive place to work!!!!!”

review.cons: Cons – You can almost count on working two or three shifts every week. Almost always need one more cashier than they are willing to pay. Nothing gets cleaned well or often enough because they keep cutting payroll to up profitsCustomers complain constantly about long lines and pump key pads never working.Help desk is so overworked that after 20 minutes of being on hold waiting for them we often hang up and send the customer away with nothing.Grave shift cashiers work all alone quite a bit of the night. No lunch, no break, no restroom break.Gaps in maintenance on weekend nights so bathrooms, garbage and showers are a total mess when day shift comes in and people complain all night about the mess
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Up payroll. We would love to keep counters clean and coffee pots filled and fresh. We would love to clean roller grill every day instead of when we have time. We would love to give friendly service instead of "Can I get you anything else thanks, next please.

review.title: “Fun employees, Horrible Company”
review.pros: Pros – I enjoyed the people I worked with - they made long shifts filled with rude customers at least somewhat entertaining.There are a couple of shift-leaders and managers who keep the job from being totally disastrous, so as long as you're working their shifts, it's not that bad.
review.cons: Cons – Rude customersFaulty equipment - our computers crash a few times a day - we're on the hold with our help desk every few hours at leastPumps that never work properlyCheapest company I've ever worked for - they're constantly trying to squeeze every dollar possible out of their employees and clientsCompletely disorganizedDon't expect to get paid for all the hours you work - they're constantly trying to stiff you hours here and there, read your pay stubs properly so they don't screw you over!Incompetent head office - they're completely oblivious to all the problems goingZero communication - they will put in place changes without telling you and then reprimand you for not following the "new" rulesTotal disrespect - you are not an employee, you are a slave; they bully you into submission and use threats to get their way
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop treating your employees like garbage, and actually invest your money into improving the company instead of getting every penny possible off of your loyal customers. Clients have been leaving our store in droves since there are so many local alternatives. The turnover is crazy high, with at least 2 or 3 employees quitting every week (we've had 11 quit in the last two weeks (including myself) - that's half our workforce!) Learn how to run a business, you cheap, lazy idiots.

review.title: “Outstanding”
review.pros: Pros – If you "consistently" work hard, produce results and improve, you will be rewarded
review.cons: Cons – Work a lot of hours. Sometimes hard to balance between work and family
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to provide updates to the employees

review.title: “I will never work for another company!!!!”
review.pros: Pros – PFJ, is a family driven!!!!
review.cons: Cons – If you are not wiling to work hard you need not apply proformance driven mangers are the key to individual growth with PFJ.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It started out great, but now it is just hell to work here.”
review.pros: Pros – good paygood benefitsstandardized computer based training for associates.
review.cons: Cons – long hours, unappreciative upper management, penny pinching to the max. lack of concern for a balance between family life and work life by above store management. Flexible? you might want to carry a pic of your family with you to see them. low pay for associates and that makes retention very difficult at store level.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Increase pay to a living wage. Quit pinching pennies. This is a family owned company, remember that your employees have families to.

review.title: “Under appreciated”
review.pros: Pros – Meeting different drivers from all over the world daily.Liberal management.
review.cons: Cons – Upper management doesn't care about the problems in the store.People are promoted for the wrong reasons.Hard work is not a matter of importance.Knowledge of products and services are not appreciated.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a second and take a look at what happens in your store. Pay attention to what employees know, and don't know. Train people properly. Give credit to those who care about the business and their work. Positive reinforcement is a great management technique.

review.title: “extremely demanding”
review.pros: Pros – Never boring, great benefits, you get to meet a great deal of customers
review.cons: Cons – A very tens atmosphere, you will get a corporate visit every week
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – it is okay to let your gm run the store, there is no needed to do weekly visits just to come around and criticized

review.title: “always a bundle of joy”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits, team work, good listeners
review.cons: Cons – open 24 hours, you bounce around the schedule
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – keep up the good work

review.title: “Its a job....its better than no job. But the company can afford to pay its hourly people better.”
review.pros: Pros – I have a set schedule.
review.cons: Cons – The payscale is horrible. 16 year old at McDonalds start off making the same pay as Pilot offers its new employees. I havent even gotten my review, or a raise....both are way overdue. Pilot is a slave driver. "Pilot...one law away from not having to pay its employees."
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It is a difficult work environment.”
review.pros: Pros – The family that owns the company cares about the employees and the pay is very competitive in the industry, It is a stable employment due to the nature of the environment.
review.cons: Cons – The management is poor and as a manager, you can expect to work 60hrs or more a week without overtime pay.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management at the retail level is not very good and they often get the job not based on experience but who they know.

review.title: “Not the best”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly down to earth managers, flexible hours, pay is not unreasonable considering, meet interesting people on both sides of the counter
review.cons: Cons – Employees are treated as potential thieves, raises are unheard of, the up selling and 2-fer goals are unrealistic in this time where no one has extra money, employee hours are constantly cut and then the next week we would be short-handed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try not looking for the negative all the time and try to encourage....negative re-enforcement has never worked...relax the witch hunt

review.title: “One Big Family”
review.pros: Pros – It was the family atmosphere of Pilot Flying J that won me over. The company is family-run, and the culture is very family-oriented. My managers and supervisors have been extremely patient & flexible regarding my schedule & my special-needs child. Working for this company, I feel more like I'm just a part of a big family that is all working together, and I really like that feeling.
review.cons: Cons – Like any large family, communication is an issue, and the larger we grow, the more of an opportunity that becomes. If we could improve our communication, especially from corporate to the field, we might do a better job of cultivating the "family" attitude more uniformly at the store level.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to "do the right thing" for employees and your people. Maintain the family-oriented attitude that has carried Pilot for so many years. It works, and it's what I love most about working here.

review.title: “It's a Career at Pilot... Not Just a Job!”
review.pros: Pros – It's just such a solid company, and because of that stability, hard working employees have the chance to grow with the company. And with all of the growth Pilot Flying J has experienced over the past year, my future feels very secure here. If you come to work and do your job well, then you are rewarded for your performance.
review.cons: Cons – There are downsides to every company, of course. The rapid growth of a company always causes some extra work for the employees, but it's worth the extra effort on my part. And PFJ rewards loyalty.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep the communication going. Mr. Haslam has always been great about communicating his vision & goals for the company. We need to hear that on a regular basis. It keeps us going in the right direction!

review.title: “Large company looking to save every penny possible....”
review.pros: Pros – paid vacation and team member rewards
review.cons: Cons – unstable management and chain of command
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – stop being so cheap, take care/pride in your stores.

review.title: “Overworked with long hours and inconsistent time off.”
review.pros: Pros – Decent pay scale and bonus program
review.cons: Cons – Up to 16hr days expected of on site management teams without added compensation or additional time off.24/7 operation created an around the clock availability necessity which was not reasonable.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ensure proper structure of management schedules to allow for proper and legal work time frames.

review.title: “Be Prepared to be treated like an idiot”
review.pros: Pros – I must say that I was promoted almost immediately upon being hired. There is a lot to do and time passes rather quickly. Great for a person with a busy body and no degree.
review.cons: Cons – I was talked down to continually even though I was much more intelligent and held greater education than most of my managers. Also, the customer complain to you about how they hate the company all day, and its hard to disagree.Employees are treated like thieves and not given any respect. I had managed for a few years in a much busier work place and they treated me like I was an idiot.The pay was atrocious, every other place would offer much more than 8.50 dollars an hour to management level employees.Also, I was required to work extremely random schedules. Often I would work 4 over night shifts and 2 day shifts a week. This destroyed any normal sleeping schedule I could muster. I was sick and sleep deprived all the time.There is also an atmosphere of backstabbing. Basically, trying to rat people out gets you praise, nothing monetarily speaking though.Overall, if you are an intelligent person who holds a degree don't even think about taking this job, I did it because I had to, but I'd rather have started my own business or worked else.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your employees with respect and compensate them fairly.

review.title: “No time spent to develop me. I believe it was my spervisor though others have had lots of time spent with.”
review.pros: Pros – Over load of information to run your business. Great benefits but costly. if you travel you are well taken care of on the road
review.cons: Cons – Came from merger. More worried about several psychological profiles. Little time spent with to be developed. Spent 3 hours with my supervisor in 6 month time span.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Follow on time spent with new managers. 70 percent of the people that came over from other company failed. Impossible for that many successful people to be poor performers. Training was truly next to none and made people feel incompetant when those that have been in system for years were the peroformers

review.title: “Governed by greed!”
review.pros: Pros – Growth organization.Reasonable pay.If you want to be in the truck stop business there aren't many choices and this is the largest.Profitable company with no danger of going out-of-business
review.cons: Cons – Really unfair to the rank and file. For the money they make, the benefits should be much better.Nobody will ever retire from there. They get rid of people before they vest in profit sharing plans.They don't encourage new thinking. You have to suck up to the boss t to get ahead and the management team realizes that. So they just kick the dog to get ahead.The company portrays itself as such great and generous people. Nothing could be farther form the truth. They are cold-blooded to the core and don't care about people. Their generosity to charities is based on what is good for the name and business.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Move away from a family business and bring in new blood. Don't completely fixate on grinding people down to make you a fortune. Ironically, this could even make you more!

review.title: “A learning experience with a twist!”
review.pros: Pros – As Flying J before it became Pilot run was a great company to work for. But, now it is very different in the sense that you are expected to work 55 to 60 hrs. per week no matter what every week. And you are only scheduled for 47.50; the same reason I had to get out of my last Management position.
review.cons: Cons – Now that it is Pilot run they are replacing all levels of management with "Pilot" managers everywhere. So beware if you are looking at their ladder to climb!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Companies such as Pilot wonder why employee's have very little respect for them and the theft rate, vandalism rates are high. Because, employee's are not treated with respect and they are treated as "machines" .

review.title: “Was cheated out of Profit sharing! Fired within a few days of payout! worked there for years!”
review.pros: Pros – The pay is great! However, the pay is not worth the work you will put in. It averages out that your employees, if they worked the same amount of hours, would probably make more than you! You work right in the middle of the day so anything in the morning is cut off , and you wont get home til late because you're not allowed to leave, even if you come in 3 hours early because you scheduled yourself in bluecube so you will have to stay unti it is scheduled to leave... so you wont get home til the kids are in bed. So you will have no family life whatsoever! It used to be a family run business and they cared about you and your family, but now it has turned into a money grubbing business that stretches every dollar out of you even if they are killing you!
review.cons: Cons – They will work you to death! If company is coming you may have to work both of your days off, spend 18 hours there while the company is there, yet you cannot take off a slow day because you've already put in your hours plus and you are exhausted! You are expected to work your schedule in spite of wether or not you've worked your days off! If you have a family DONT work here!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – When I first started working for Pilot, they cared about their managers! I remember a time when you were treated like a human and not a work horse. Now, they expect you to stretch yourself so thin that you are no longer able to function. You are away from your family way too much and if somebody is coming expect to work nonstop for a couple of days before, because what they expect of you wont be done because you are more worried about customers in stead of the mondane things, you get to them, but they are not most important. Then once the company comes, expect to be at the store until your scheduled to time to leave, doesn't matter if you've camped out there, came in 4 hours early because company was coming, worked all your days off, and are exhausted and about to fall over. Most companies allow their GM's and RM's to have some authority and understand that they are the ones who go through most of the stress and work very hard... and shouldn't be measured by a time clock! A GM should be measured for job performance not bluecube! I remember a time when we would get visits and my Regional would see the hard work, and after the company would leave he would say "go ahead and go on home! You deserve it!" that sort of thing is impossible now! they watch you like a hawk thinking you are "pirating time"! It's not pirating time if you have worked your hind end off all week and need rest! It's not wrong to leave work 15 minutes early because you came in 4 hours early to handle a call in. But you will get fired if you work different that your bluecube schedule!I would not advise working for this company now! If you would have ask me that question a couple of years back I would have went all out about what a great company this is and how much Jimmy loves his people! I don't think that way anymore! I think the dollar has gone to his head and a once great company that was proud of how it treated it's managers now has lost it's foothold in morals!My hourly employees were treated much better than GMs or RGMs. If they got mad at you because you documented them for being late several times or whatever, they would call the hotline on you, then you would get in trouble! But you were doing your job! GMs would get nothing in a Christmas bonus... but hourly employees received a small gift card! I don't think a bonus that you earn should compensate for a Christmas bonus!If you don't have a family, don't mind working your days off and continuing on with the rest of your work schedule... being called on to the hotline over stupid things... working not for your money but for far beyond your capabilities...then this is the job for you!Sure it pays very well! I made very good money! But it wasn't worth the time I lost from my children! I would get home at 9:30 or 10pm at night and sometimes past midnight, my kids would be asleep and my spouse would be asleep. They would get up far before me because I was exhausted. I would get up, go to work and do it all over again... that's on the times I did go home! Quite a few times I had to pull all day and all nighters because if you can't find someone to replace a call in... you are stuck! And if I did get a day off I was so exhausted from working nonstop and rarely even gettng time to eat. Because when you are on salary with Pilot, you ensure your hourly employees get a lunch and ten minute breaks, you also are a moral person so you ensure your Co-managers get a lunch break and a smoke break if needed...but you are stuck without eating quite a few times! Because Pilot doesn't have a program in place to ensure their GMs get a break! They do not believe their GM's are human I guess! Work like a horse and not eat or sit down!! They have these slots in bluecube that shows breaks for everyone, even salaray managers, but ask any Pilot GM or RGM if they get a lunch break or a ten minute break! They are lucky to sit down for two seconds! Labor is so tight you have to make up the difference plus ensure everything else is done! Pilot is no longer morally right!

review.title: “Warning-Think Twice”
review.pros: Pros – Decent salary and benefits. Nothing else
review.cons: Cons – Terrible work/home life balance...terrible hours...
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – none-stick it..

review.title: “pilot travel not what it claims to be”
review.pros: Pros – good pay, training good, get to eat at a discount
review.cons: Cons – you have to live there to be paid that good salary you are getting, no life other than work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – get real. people have families, church, friends. lot more to life than working my butt off for you.

review.title: “Happy at Pilot”
review.pros: Pros – Nice company to work for.
review.cons: Cons – not a lot of team members so call outs are a big issues.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be consices

review.title: “Good work environment.”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunities to work on interesting projects.Great people.
review.cons: Cons – High turn over. The company has not had the best insurance benefits.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More communication would be helpful.

review.title: “tough place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Small family atmosphere at store
review.cons: Cons – Be prepared to work 60+ hours a week. Not by choice, but becasue of payroll constraints.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Law of diminishing returns....Sooner or later, you have to put payroll back into the store to get the job done as expected....

review.title: “Something to consider...”
review.pros: Pros – Available opportunity to advance within the company. Once you understand all the processes involved the business is all about maintaining standards.
review.cons: Cons – If your not interested in marriage or personal life, this is the job for you. Work schedules will vary from 50-70 hrs a week being the high end. Nothing less than 50 as this is a standard for ALL salaried employees NO EXCEPTIONS!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Not much to say here. A leader is there to train, guide, and motivate in the right path for success. Lets make sure this is 100 across the board.

review.title: “wow!”
review.pros: Pros – the best reason to work at pilot travel center is that it is a job and right now those are hard to find
review.cons: Cons – you bust your hump, available for any hours, dont ever call off and the fact that you cant force people to buy 2 packs of smokes and your no longer worth thier time as an employee if you dont mind being treated like dirt and constantly haveing your job threatened this is the place for you,
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – treat your employees with respect instead of beating them down and then saying thats still not good enough, even better try working in the conditions you created

review.title: “Pilot is a very strong company financially. Work hard and you will grow with the company”
review.pros: Pros – variety of things to do. not bored
review.cons: Cons – shifts change all the time. hard to plan things
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – n/a

review.title: “some good some bad”
review.pros: Pros – great entertainment if your into laughing at grumpy people all day. fast paced so the time goes by quickly. they do have a 1-800 number for employees to call for issues their having. GM has every weekend off (only a pro if your a GM). Insurance available. 1/2 off at subway (up to $4.00)
review.cons: Cons – bad hours for shift leaders, some weeks they do all three shifts 1st, 2nd & 3rds. raises are few and far between. not enough employees, if someone calls in your shift is gonna be bad because there's no one else to call to come in. TOO MUCH POLITICS.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – hold all employees to the same standards. promote by work performance and ability not likeability. listen when people tell you others are stealing.

review.title: “No life outside of work.Hourly employees get only two holidays Managers none.No personal days,”
review.pros: Pros – The experience of learning many sides of a full service restaurant.Testing your strenth , weakness and abilties for every kind of food service.
review.cons: Cons – Schedules done the day before you work.Reviews done only when you beg.Restaurant side is never on the same playing field as the C-Store.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They spend so much time worring their employees are takiing from them and never seeing how much they give of themselves.They should have been watchiing the top people before they went bankrupt.

review.title: “It used to be great.”
review.pros: Pros – None within the last three years. 10 years ago it was a great place to work. We were proud of our stores then.
review.cons: Cons – Quality of Life was not in favor of the employee. Money has been taken out of the stores' payroll and gained elsewhere.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give more back to the communities where your stores exist; not just in Knoxville or the University of TN. Make more store level employees full time and pay them what they are worth. Your turnover will be much lower.

review.title: “Pilot's a terrible place for center managers”
review.pros: Pros – Best reason for working for Pilot is that it does give you experience in working with retail. Many times it's the only real opportunity for work in some areas of the country Pilot services
review.cons: Cons – Long hours. Upper management (regional and up) are made up of people who would not be able to successfully run a center as they are asking it to be run. Manager's 3 year turnover expectation (Pilot expect to burn out it's managers and turn them over every 3 years). Move up or out culture (4 years). A CEO who has a terrible god complex.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – quit burning out your center managers so you can maximize your dollars.
